turn.3: That’s not correct. Firstly black holes are not formed from developing stars and whether you use the Schwarzschild or Kerr models doesn’t change that. As well as that there was no empirical evidence of black holes at this point. What Schwarzschild did was solve Einstein’s equations for the case of a theoretical non rotating neutral black hole. He did not present it as anything other than this. This was a necessary first step towards a more general solution of the more complex case of a rotating black hole which is more likely in reality. It wasn’t until much later that we would have true empirical evidence that black holes can exist in the universe
